intro: Scorzonera sericeolanata, commonly known as the silverleaf scorzonera, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage, which gives it its common name. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, adding ornamental value to its natural habitat. Scorzonera sericeolanata is typically found in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes. Its ecological role includes providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a habitat for small invertebrates.
